A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In post- colonial London, Susie Brewer, a vicious aristocratic teenager finds herself disowned for falling in love with an Irish Catholic. Hated for her "nigger blood" because she slept with a black man once, she prepares herself to take revenge , and sees it as potentially achievable since she now owns a

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

For a dystopian piece you feel like you don't necessarily care about what's happening to those characters, but it does a good job of making sure that you are on board with any decisions made by those on screen.
The emotions in Weightless felt natural (seeing as they still spoke Japanese).

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: “Early Years” (with music track named “Freesia”) and “Working Days, Quit Working Days” (track: “Exitus”). I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may disagree with me on this title, saying that the story is way to childish to be taken seriously as a work of art, however, if we think about it a little longer we start realizing that beyond the comedy and fantasy moments found in the movie there's more than meets our eyes.
